alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Forsyth (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 4:52PM EST until January 09 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Davidson and Forsyth. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 452 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated continued periods of moderate rain. This will cause small stream flooding to continue this evening. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen in portions of western Forsyth and northern Davidson counties. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible over the area. This additional rain will prolong in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Winston-Salem, Lexington, Clemmons, King, Huntsville, Linwood, Lewisville, Walkertown, Rural Hall, Arcadia, Welcome, Pfafftown, Sedge Garden, and Stanleyville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
